description:
Let's get one thing out of the way: I love all Mexican food.  I love Tacolicious.  I love La Taqueria.  My truest love is for that particular breed of San Diego taquerias that grill their tortillas and wrap them up in wax paper, almost all of which have names that contain "bertos."  At the right time of the night, I will even find some love for Taco Bell.  So you know, my Mexican food love knows no bounds.  

But there is a special place in my heart for a friendly, low-key, comfortable sit-down restaurant where beans and rice are always on the side of a plate that (you're sure to be forewarned) is too hot to touch.  Where my margarita glass always seems to be empty, even though I just refilled it (seriously, how does that happen?).  Puerto Alegre is solidly excellent Mexican food.  At least four stars just on the strength of the Mama's Special (cheese enchilada and a chile relleno) alone, which I can't seem to move past on the menu.  The service is fast and friendly.  And I always have a great time there. So glad the Mission still has room for places like this.
author: Quinton H.

description:
I went to Puerto Alegre with a friend for late lunch. We were quick to get seated, which is sometimes hard because they can get pretty busy during peak hours. 

The margaritas were pretty good, not the best I've ever had but pretty good all things considered. I ordered the Puerto Alegre cadillac, it was pretty strong.

For food, I had the nachos with carne asada. The carne was pretty flavorful and they really pile on the cheese and guacamole. It was a ton of food. 

Overall, it was a pretty good experience.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
I fucking love this place

I currently am 3 margarita's deep as I write this, and as an avid drinker,  I'm impressed by the potency of these fine fine drinks. 

Been coming here for years now, and they never disappoint. I wish NYC could produce this type of Mexican food; but alas, I digress. 

Amazing food, strong drink, my favorite haunt in SF.
author: Ben D.

description:
Frijoles con queso was great. What's better than good refined beans and melted Monterey Jack cheese with chips?

I ordered the custom enchilada and burrito combo The enchilada had cheese inside and red sauce on top. The burrito was all right and but the guacamole inside was good. The rice was good and so were the refried beans.

Strawberry margaritas were all right, not the best actually, too sweet! Needed tartness imo. 

My favorite part of the meal were the chips and salsa. Their salsa is amazing. 


I'd come back.
author: Shruti D.

description:
With fantasy alcohol and much Mexican, you can enjoy Latin there. This time, I came here with my friend. Before coming, I didn't know much about Mission District. But there're so many Mexican and Latin restaurants, I like it. Unfortunately, I can't eat cilantro. So I ordered anything with "No cilantro, please".
Awesome Avocado Nachos coming to me. That's very very delicious and  Latin Margarita matches with. I want to come here again in my stay in San Francisco.
author: Shun Y.

description: I love this place and the owner.  My friends have been coming here for years and brought me in.  This place reminds me of the Mexican food I love in Sacramento that I haven't been able to find in the city. We shared a couple of margarita pitchers that were really good and I had the chicken enchiladas.
author: Brandy B.

description: I love everything about this place, from the radical environmentalist posters on the walls to the friendly staff to their impressively comprehensive selection of margaritas... but if you want to know why I'm finally getting off my lazy ass and giving them the 5 star review they deserve, you need to order the Milanesa. It's like the Mexican equivalent of chicken fried steak, except the recipe was brought here by a brave chef who travelled to the edge of the world and spent decades studying the fine art of chicken fried steak with a group of monks who have been perfecting the recipe for centuries. I've never had a bad thing here, but the Milanesa? That shit is game changing. Go get it. Now. You can thank me later.
author: Kathleen P.

description: We've been coming here for over a decade now. Definitely our favorite Mexican food in the Mission. The House Margaritas are fantastic. We could order the Quesadilla Suiza w/ Carne Asada & Avocado every trip, but then we'd miss the other amazing food. I definitely suggest anything with their stewed beef, Chile Colorado.
author: Danny G.

description:
I read another recent review and the same exact thing happened to us... VERY RUDE bartender/manager. We were standing by the bar waiting for someone to leave, when this manager, or whoever he is, comes out of nowhere and starts yelling at me in Spanish, saying I cannot stand by the bar. I explain to him that we are waiting to grab a seat at the bar momentarily but he continues to be in my face.  I thought that perhaps he didn't understand me, so I told him that I would talk to my friend and tell my friend that he was trying to say.  My friend who speaks Spanish better then went to talk to him, and this guy goes off on my friend.  We decided to leave, but this rude manager starts cussing as we are leaving, not really sure why that is necessary. 

I live and work in the area and used to bring many of my coworkers here for lunch and never had a problem. The food is okay, but I will NEVER bring anyone from my workplace here.  You lost a loyal customer.  There is no need to be rude and make a scene when all we are doing patiently waiting to grab a seat at the bar.  This is the worse service I've seen on the Valencia corridor and I've been to most of these bars and restaurants.  This one is a no go.
author: Christiani C.

description:
Friday. Hungry. Haven't eaten all day.

Atmosphere: dark like a bar. There's a bar (not a full one) but way to dark for a restaurant in the middle of the day.

Atmosphere: mainly older folks coming in for some dinner.

Service: crappy. We originally asked to move seats because our party wasn't going to fit. The server shot us an irritated look and said "sure". Also, after we received our food he never checked back on us which bothers me.

Food: my dad ordered the exact thing as two other people in our party but his order lacked the onions that were supposed to come with it. 

Margaritas were watery.

I ordered a burrito and it was served "wet" (covered in sauce). I feel like he should have asked if that was my preference because the last time I ate here the burrito wasn't served to me like that.

The meat in the burrito was crispy and flavorless.

The chips were flavorless and the salsa was runny.

Just a disappointing experience. 

I will not be returning here.
author: Bobbi A.

description:
Horrific experience. The waiter/host threw a piece of paper at my face!

He was so rude. We waited over an hour, he  kept asking too look at our ticket and after about 35 minutes, he promised we would be seated next, then continued to seat other people who arrived after us. When he finally had a table for us, he very rudely sat is there, and proceeded to ask for my ticket AGAIN (third time in a 15 minute span). I was livid and sassy, but he took the ticket, screamed at me and my friends for giving him attitude, telling us to get more manners, and then threw the ticket at my face. My face! Wtf.

We did not eat there. We went to West of Pecos instead. I hear the food is ok but overpriced for the quality and shitty long line. There's so much good Mexican in the mission. I'd die before returning to Puerto Alegre.
author: Juanita J.

description: Yesterday: My favorite place for margarita, tequila and guacamole. Food and service is great! love coming here when I'm in the area. The owner Eric is awesome !
author: Christy V.

description: An excellent spot for great Mexican food in the mission. Sometimes I want authentic Mexican but not just at a burrito joint. This is in a perfect location and the atmosphere is fantastic. Great staff, the Frida Kahlo art was fantastic, and their celebration of women and culture was very present. Love it!
author: Katie S.

description:
After frequenting this family joint for their wet burrito and blended margarita since 1980's, it's time to give it 5 stars. Yes, i am old, but good things don't depreciate. Will update after next 40.
... btw... the place has not changed since i entered it first... same decor, same boxes and table lay out. No cheeze hipness as in most of the Valencia eateries this is such true classic San Franisco,   ...
author: Jane T.

description:
Ok I seriously LOVED this place and being a SoCal native, the food tasted pretty original. I ordered the taco bowl with shrimp and the portion size was perfect. The shrimp tasted great! 

I am subtracting 1 star for the discombobulated front desk situation. We came on a Friday night and was told the wait would be 30 minutes. They gave us a piece of paper that had a number on it, 12. They were calling out random numbers, 36, 4, 9.. as if it was a lotto for seats. We ended up waiting almost an hour and had seen people sat before us that had arrived after us. That's my only complaint. Maybe take names? 

The place is tiny but worth the wait.
author: Jessica C.

description: Well what can I say it's been a minute since I've eaten here well three weeks but I'm back like Cracker Jack.
author: RICHARD J.

description: Love Puerto Alegre!  A traditional old style Mexican restaurant on Valencia between 16th and 17th, how unusual these days!  3 big screens for sports fans, good food and drink.  Excellent service.  Happy hour.  One of my favorites in SF.
author: mickey M.

description:
Don't bother. Only come for drinks. They have pitcher margaritas which they put a decent amount of really cheap tequila in, so it's great to split with a group of friends, but don't bother eating here. 

Food was comparable to cafeteria Mexican at best, yet was still priced like it was a higher end restaurant that actually uses good, high-end ingredients.

Meal for two with two drinks $50. The owners should really step their ingredient game up and bring more flavor to their food, or bring their prices down. 

Michelada $8.50 - ca'mon

West of Pecos is next door and the same price, with a much better ambience and the food is amazing there.
author: I S.

description: I order to pick up Pozole and all i can say its BAD!! Sucks flavor less !! And has " BACON INSIDE" really bacon !!! Grease !! Salty!!  just green salsa chip mix all the meats and boom you got pozole and don't forget the bacon !! No FLAVOR AT ALL !!!!!
author: Zurdo R.

description: Little could beat the Vegetable Fajita / Pitcher of Margarita combo at Puerto Allegre. Authentic and great tasting food. The service is quick and attentive. You have the option to sit inside or outside and enjoy Valencia street. I'm sure to stop in for a meal here whenever I'm in town!
author: Ariel M.

description: I was surprised to come here and get seated right away. I was expecting a wait on Thu evening but there wasn't....probably coz there is no dearth of Mexican restaurants on Valencia. The service was pretty good. They kept checking on us. The food wasn't bad but wasn't extra ordinary either. Salsa was good, chips were just fine, beans was watery so we ordered the mashed one. Churros were good but quite cinnamon-y like most American churros. The musician came close to our table while singing and then later did a walk for tip and he made sure he did not leave until he got the tip :p
author: Tejashree M.

description: Great place to visit when you're in San Francisco, family that runs the place have been living here all their lives,true San franciscans the food is great atmosphere is good what can I say it's like being home
author: Joseph L.

description: A old classic and personal favorite whenever I'm in San Francisco. Great to catch a game here especially with a pitcher of margaritas.
author: Lauren H.

description:
We came here specifically because they have both Pozole and Siete Mares soups.

We also ordered their shrimp cocktail. The cocktail was VERY disappointing. Approximately 6 small overcooked shrimp in a very tomato paste-like sauce.  This was 15.95!

The Siete Mares broth was also very tomato-paste like.  Mostly zucchini and carrots, and what little seafood there was in there (4 kinds at best) was minimal and of poor quality.  The broth was nothing special at all.

The pozole verde did have a lovely broth, with a ton of huge hominy, big chunks of different kinds of meat(one was bacon which is new to me in Pozole), but it wasn't served with the usual onions, cilantro and cabbage.  It came with shredded lettuce and radishes. Overall though, this I cannot give a bad review.

The waitstaff was very kind and attentive.
author: Song H.

description: By far the best sit down Mexican food restaurant I've found in San Francisco. Is a standard sizzling skillet of fajitas too much to ask for? Everywhere else in town it seems like it is, but Puerto Alegre successfully sticks to doing the basics well. The chips and salsa are great too!
author: Chris S.

description: Absolutely LOVE this place. Been coming here for years. First time I came here it reminded me of my grandmothers rice and beans. The atmosphere, the food, it's amazing. And girrrrrrlllll don't talk to me about some Celia's bullshit
author: Julie V.

description: My first time and I loved it.  My daughter recommended as she always eats here.  The margaritas are delicious!   I love all the varieties of tequila they offer.  I ordered an enchilada and Chile relleno both were very good.  The rice is yummy and I loved the black beans.  The salsa is delicious.  The wait staff is super nice.
author: Wendy B.

description: My wife and I have lived in San Francisco for 25 years now and we go to Puerto Alegre almost every weekend. It is hands down our favorite Mexican place in the city. We can't fathom how their average Yelp rating is only 3 1/2 stars. The experience is so much better than that. My wife loves the chicken and shrimp fajitas. I love the chicken enchiladas potosinas. Friendly staff, great margaritas. We love this place!
author: Zach M.

description:
What a gem in the rough!

Ok, I'll grant you, it doesn't seem like the nicest area, and there are a TONNE of Mexican restaurants around here to choose from, but as we had a gift voucher for this one, out decision was already made for us.

I was very very pleasantly surprised and would definitely recommend you to come here - if only for the coctel de camarones and the house margarita! I've had coctel de camarones at a number of restaurants in both Mexico and California and I have found my new favourite! The juice was thick and flavorful with an abundance of shrimp (hate when a place scrimps on the shrimps) and not too spicy to start out! Oh my goooooodness it was so delicious!

It was a shame that the margarita had so much ice in and that the service was kinda on the slow side, but the waitresses friendly attitude and extra chips and salsa went a long way towards making up for the wait :P

There's loads of meter parking around here, but it's free on a Sunday (and they serve brunch until 2pm), so get yourself down here to see what takes your fancy.

As an added bonus they have tvs showing all the games so now excuse guys ;)
author: Jemma B.

description:
The people were super nice, but the food definitely lacks flavor. I got a Carne Asada Grande Burrito, for some reason it was pretty bland. My got a combo: sope and flauta, and the flauta didn't even look like a flauta. It was more of an enchilada. 
The salsa was decent on the chips, but only on the chips.
author: S L.

description: On a positive note the bartender did prepare a nice cocktail. I don't recommend the food at all. I had the standard enchiladas plate and 25 minutes later suffered cramps and indigestion. By mid meal the musician comes to every table singing Ranchera music. With all the ambience already this is EXTRA. (he expects a tip) If you're into the authentic feel of a greasy spoon dive and mediocre food then this spot is for you I guess.
author: Hale L.

description: Great guacomole, great chips and very good appetizers!!! If you like tequila, come here. If you like churros, come here. If you like good authentic Mexican food, this is the spot. The hospitality is fantastic. Felt at home eating here. Family restaurant and it shows.
author: Andrew A.

description: Hmmm... why frozen wings tho?!?! We watch too much bar recuse to not know the difference between fresh & frozen wings. Staff is friendly. Margaritas are really good. As a guac snob :( it's really watery. But it tasted ok.
author: Khadeejah S.

description: Ugh! So decided to give this resto a chance. THe most mediocre Mexican food ever. Our pitcher of margarita was mainly ice. For the 2nd I specifically asked for less ice. Didn't see any difference. So this is what I commit to doing Puerto management - I will NEVER go to ur resto again. AND I will tell everyone I know about my experience. That adds up to a bit of cash in the end. Maybe think twice b4 u sell just ice in ur margarita.
author: Eric K.

description: I had heard about this restaurant for months as the best Mexican restaurant in San Francisco, so I was excited to check it out. We went on a Friday night, at around 6:45 pm. There were a lot of people waiting for tables outside, yet the hostess told me it would be 20-25 minutes. An hour later, she sat us at a table being shared by another couple. There were two other open tables but she refused to reseat us. The hostess barely looked at us when we complained. Very disappointed by the rude staff. We left and ate at the taqueria on the corner and had a great meal. Won't return here again.
author: Otis M.

description: What a fun place. Puerto Alegra serves mexican comfort food. It's not fancy or modern, it's just tasty. The staff were so friendly to us from beginning to end. Chatty, attentive, kind, smiles. They really set the tone for a good time. I appreciated that they had rainbows up for Pride month. We sat at the bar. I had the Gigantes margarita, which was perfectly concocted and delicious. No crappy marg mix in that. The Momma's Special and the Fajitas Camerone's were delicious, and the churros dessert is so huge we took some home. Best to eat those in house though, because they get hard at home. This restaurant is the kind of local gem you want to stick around forever.
author: Mark S.

description:
Poor Service and sub par mexican food in the Center of the Mexican Food meccas. With some amazing award winning restaurants surrounding this place youd think this place would step up its game and at least try to be different? Nope. You literally could only grab a server when they drop something off at your table. We all waved to several people and we knew they saw us but the eye rolls and the ignoring was insanely bad. 

Ok, well maybe the food was amazing. HA, nope. The chimichangas were chimino no's. Bland tasteless and soiled, go ahead try it if you dont believe me. The rice had no flavor and was basically puffy air. The one thing they had going for it was the quesadilla I had. Never had a boiled chicken quesadilla. Man was it soft. The only bad I had to say was I wished the tortilla was toasted a tad more and there was so much cheese inside (not warm and melty but half melty) it just tasted like thick goo in my mouth. The caddy Margrittas we had tasted watered down and the price was way to much. Save yourself a bad night and only go her eif you have to cuz youre to drunk to go anywhere else. 

=( this is why i only go to the places I know are good, you try to ventur eout and try another place and it only reminds you of how awesome the place you should have gone to is.
author: Attic F.

description: I've been coming here for 14 years. By far my favorite Mexican restaurant in SF. The Carne Asada Suiza with Avocado can't be matched. Their margaritas is strong, but delicious and the Michelads are always on point. Try the Pozole Verde too. Great staff and a awesome casual vibe.
author: Mark G.

description:
I had been following this place on instagram for several months now, everything in the pictures looked really nice. When we finally went to try it out, it was a failure. Food was not good, except for the mole.   The mole was ok,   Service was nice, but price and food didn't make sense. The food had not much flavor, and it was expensive. The drinks were ok. Although, it didn't look nothing like the picture on Instagram lol. The menu needs pictures to identify food and drinks since the drink that I ordered (Margarita Classic w/ grand marnier) came in a simple glass instead of a margarita bowl with a mini grand marnier bottle upside down (like in instagram).   After I asked the person helping us out, he said that the drink I wanted wasn't on the menu.  But he went ahead and changed it for me. (Extra star for that)
Wish the owner could step their game up, Limon, next door is so nice, Pancho Villa around the corner has better food for half the price.
author: Hugo G.

description:
This is one of the last *real* Mexican places left on Valencia street. Puerto Alegre has endured while much of the rest of the street has been replaced with hipster boutiques - little establishments with no clear business model - selling whatever they think the hapless techie or tourist will buy. Ooh, that's a cool looking water bottle made out of copper. Yeah, they'll buy that. Ooh look, it's a bar of soap made by a girl with weird hair! It must be authentic.

Anyway, when you're done buying your $50 tee-shirt with the pithy slogan on it, go frequent one of the local restaurants - a *real* San Francisco place that doesn't look as pretty or *ahem* FAMILIAR as all of the other cookie-cutter hipster industrial-chic I'm-so-quirky-I-could-just-scream places. Go get a real margarita. Get the combo plate with one of everything you could possibly want on it. Eat so much food you want to barf. Drink enough to get you the rest of the way there. Rinse, repeat, and take pride in the fact you've helped keep San Francisco a weird and wonderful place. You can't do that if you go to Chipotle. Well maybe you can, but not without getting arrested. Anyway, that's a story for another time. Go to Puerto Alegre. It's awesome, and if you go there, you will be too.
author: Tom S.

description: Good local place. Enjoyed the margaritas and the salsa was one of the good ones. Stars off for just okay service and the tortilla for the burrito. Tasted store bought, but the chile colorado beef filling and salsa roja on top helped it out.
author: Monica Q.

description: s mediocre!!  This is what millennial buzz does to the Mission. So many better places in SF!!
author: bruce b.

description: My friends and I come to this place weekly! It's one of the best Mexican food restaurants in the city! My favorite dish is the camarones a la diabla. I highly suggest! Their margaritas are also amazing! 10/10 would recommend!
author: Shaun D.

description: Great service and food, reminds me of the food my neighbor made for me as a child growing up in the mission!
author: Lenee'a G.

description:
Food = good. 

Table top salsa and chips = win. They gave us two salsa...the bright red one is awesome!  Thin and crispy chips! 

Combo Numero Uno (shredded beef crispy taco, chile relleno, and chicken enchilada, with rice, black beans and small side salad) = awesome. Best chile relleno I've had, but then again I'm partial to eggs; great beef taco and chicken enchilada, too. We didn't like the rice. $13.95

Chimichangas a la Chicanesa = two smokey flavored chicken burritos, deep fried and topped with tomatoes, sour cream and avocado. Comes with rice, refried beans and a small side salad. Delicious chicken and he loved the refried beans, too. We didn't like the rice.  $14.95

Guacamole = a ton of awesome guac. Next time, we'll bring more people. $9.85

Cadillac margarita (anejo & cointreau) = delicious. Strong, and it's real lime juice! $12.50.

Coke = $2.85

Service = friendly. Attentive. 

Seating = mostly 2-tops and 4-tops.  They have a few booths and they're hard to come by. On a typical day/night, there's a long wait outside. Somehow, on this fine sunny Saturday afternoon, we lucked out and it was pretty quiet here. 

Prices = moderate. Lunch for two came out to $58.90 with leftovers.
author: Fannie S.

description: Will never go here again, nor would I ever send anyone here for fear that they would immediately drop me as a friend, possibly even resorting to leaving burning bags of poop on my doorstep. The service is not bad actually, but as is typical for the mission, the quality of food and the caliber of drinks doesn't come close to providing any sort of reasonable value given the price of each. The pitcher of margarita had two, maybe three drops of tequila in it. It was terribly sweet and full of ice. The dishes were served with iceberg lettuce, a slice of tomato, and refried beans - of course, typical for a mexican or el salvadoran sit-down restaurant - just don't charge me like I'm eating out at some new, hip restaurant with locally-sourced ingredients and blah blah blah [insert more hipster restaurant douchery here].
author: Brian N.

description: Yessss that quesedilla! Got the carne asada and it was the perfect size -- i.e. not three times the size of my stomach. (I'm still getting used to these US portions.) Loved all the cheese, loved the seasoning on the meat, loved the service from our fab waitress. Free chips to kick you off is always a treat, too. Sadly didn't get a chance to try the margs (school night) but given the press, I think I'll have to come back. Only critique is that getting seated and sorting the check was a little slow -- but it *was* Valentine's day, so... can't really be helped I'm sure. Great wee spot!
author: Rowena H.

description: Service was fast, food was tasty. I appreciate they didn't make a huge deal about our service animal.
author: Jackie Z.

description:
Can't say enough about this place; I hate to reveal the "secret ". Great service, generous margaritas, and DELICIOUS food.
Nice mixture of people. Mostly locals; few tourists, which is nice. 
Authentic Mexican food. Occasional Mariachi Bands come by. Very fun, friendly place. Salsa and chips are addicting.
author: Jane L.

description:
A decade ago I was a regular and this restaurant was my happy place either with a huge group of friends out on the town for the evening or with a smaller more intimate group of best friends or favorite boyfriends. 

It never disappointed in terms of yummy food and drinks and a fun/relaxed atmosphere. Any Mexican restaurant I visit to this day, the food and drinks are benchmarked to my favorites here.

Today I returned with my children and though I wish they weren't picky eaters that is my (fingers crossed (temporary)) current plight in life. 

Two things of note, my fond memories were validated and of bigger note, my finicky young eaters absolutely LOVED the food. My son even went so far as to say their rice was better than cake and pizza. I love the food here but I do love the occasional piece of cake or pizza and though the rice was great for me I'm not sure it would be better than cake. Well you get the idea, this is a fun, affordable and delicious Mexican restaurant today and 10+ years ago. Very reliable and worth the wait on weekend evenings.
author: Jane V.

description:
Okay, I admit to being biased here; they are family, but let me tell you, I've been coming here my whole life, since I was tiny and my grandmother dragged me up through the Mission so she could cook. Puerto Allegre, now run by the next generation has not lost its authenticity in food nor ambiance. In fact, I would dare say they've "polished" the authenticity.
The food remains amazing and true to Mexico. They currently invite local Latino artist to display art (for sale) throughout the restaurant walls, and well then there is the drinks.....another story. Great collection of tequilas and kick-ass, award winning margaritas.
Be prepared to wait and pine outside to get a coveted table. I'm just saying.
author: Mercy V.

description: I have been here before and loved it, cheap and delicious food. However, this review is about the LACK OF CUSTOMER SERVICE and extremely rude staff. I came in with a group of about 3-4 people, waiting on 1-2 ppl join. It wasn't a busy night, in fact Wednesday around 8pm. Two of our party arrived early and sat at the bar in seat, and ordered drinks. I joined and our group was told NO ONE can stand at the bar. Totally fine, however it the manager or bartender or lead guy who was walking around being VERY rude to people including our party. He snapped at us, told us he can only speak to one person when all we asked was our whole party is here can we be seated. He was so rude, and instead we went next door to West of Pecos who told us they wouldn't be rude to us we could stand anywhere and instead got seated right away. Awesome food and we were glad to give West of Pecos $250 of our business. I use to love this spot but I'm sure anyone who wants a nice dinner out wants to be treated rudely because a manager doesn't like his life. I was going to take friends visiting from out of the country to authentic Mexican but NOW I will NEVER consider here. Fire that manager/guy because he was terrible, rude and the epitome of lack of customer service. Bye Felicia!
author: Priya S.

description: We visit Puerto Alegre a couple times a month during brunch time on the weekends and enjoy the warm service by their beautiful servers, the best pitcher margaritas and their kick ass fajitas. The owners are always there to welcome you back. We Love Puerto Alegre!
author: Angela M.

description: I've been here a couple of times now.  Both experiences were great!  The staff were friendly and the food and drinks came out quickly.  I have to say, they serve the best Cadillac Margarita!  Sometimes live Mexican bands pop in and play little songs for cash tips and that makes the night even more fun.  The place isn't fancy, so come as you are and bring friends!
author: Shaun W.

description:
A festive atmosphere.
Solid Mexican food.  
Great salsa. 
Strong margaritas.

I actually love the salsas here.  I, along w several coworkers, would come in after work just to do chips, salsa, & pitchers of margaritas.

Service is good, too.  Fast & friendly.  We've sat at the bar, ordered margaritas & lunch, & were served everything in about 5 minutes.  Drinks right away, followed by the grub.  Of course, table service on a busy night is going to take longer.  But we never feel neglected or abandoned, & the staff stays well humored.  Hang in there.

The grub...
Old school Mexican.  No frills, but authentic.  Large plates & portions.  The entrees themselves go between being bland to good.  It's hit or miss.  For a lot of bang for your buck, this is a good spot.  In a neighborhood that is downright overridden w hole in the wall taquerias, this is a rare & welcome full sit down Mexican restaurant.

First come, first served.  The wait can be long, it gets packed, & crazy, on busy nights & the weekends.  Nurse a margarita, enjoy your company, & have a good time.  

3 & 1/2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: A sit-down Mexican place with great salsa and delicious food. Service could sometimes be a bit warmer, but he food is delicious. I especially love the diablo shrimp. Great depth of flavor and heat level. Been coming here for years and will continue :)
author: Christine H.

description: Fantastic place!  The $5 margaritas were perfect. The staff was so friendly. They just kept those nachos coming, even after we finished dinner. The meal was very tasty, in fact it was some of the best Mexican I have eaten. Live music with a Spanish guitar player right at the table. A must visit place when you are by Delores Park.
author: Christine H.

description: Nice place on Valencia St. Very good service and great fresh Mexican food. Sunday Brunch is so good. Will be back again.
author: John E.

description: Delicious and great service!!  The best house margaritas around and I LOVE the black beans and picante sauce...
author: Lynda M.

description: Never been disappointed here. Fresh, tasty Mexican fare. Good service. Left feeling more than satisfied.
author: Danny A.

description:
I had the best enchiladas of my life, but of course I can't remember what they were called. 

I do know that it was a red sauce and a green sauce, which Carmen (our super sweet, not to mention sexy waitress) graciously informed the kitchen to give me both since I couldn't make up my mind, although she seemed unsure of my request, it turned out to be a match made in heaven. 

Although it's hard to say which was better, if I had to pick,I say go with the green. Either way, just go.
author: Layne C.

description: I previously wrote an unfair review for Puerto Alegre based solely on the wait times we experienced as a group. Truth be told, some of my best memories from living in San Francisco was to meet up with my "family" of friends every Sunday at 3:00 at Puerto Alegre. We did this for years. Junior would make us pitchers of margaritas and we'd casually enjoy catching up from the week while enjoying their great menu. We loved the consistently good food and strong margaritas that were amazingly cheap back then ($11). I'd give them 5 stars if the same people were still there but it seems its changed a bit since the old days. Of course, most things do!! I'll always enjoy the memories.
author: Holly L.

description: The food was really good and the service was great. Only three stars because the margaritas are weak and all ice. This place used to rock the drinks!
author: Lu L.

description:
Great spot! 5 stars for food, 4 stars for ambiance, 4.5 for service. 

We ordered the prawn fajita and carne asada burritos. Fantastic! In fact, my bf said it might have been his best burrito ever.

The wait staff was also great. She was quick and the guy was great at clearing our dishes and completely wiping down the counter immediately. Overall, impressed!

It has a dive bar feel. Not my favorite.
author: Kendra C.

description:
The margaritas are awesome, the guac is top notch, and the service is fast and on point. 

As always thanks for feeding my weekly cravings!
author: Charles P.

description: Love this place,  been going for 25years, the staff is so friendly it's like going to tia's house and can't believe I haven't written a review till now.  I wish you guys another 25!!!
author: Dealan E.

description:
This place is awesome. Me and 7 other people showed up at 10pm on a Saturday and it was packed inside. But the service was out of this world and the food was awesome. 

We ran out of chips & salsa... boom! Someone showed up with more. Ordered a drink... Two minutes later bam! It's on the table. Usually in this environment I'd expect a tired, grumpy waitress and waiting around all night for food, but no, they were super nice and food came out at a good pace.

Beyond all this, the food was BANGIN. I got a burrito with stewed chicken and damn it was good. 

I know your nervous not going to your usual spot in the mission. Maybe your friends are relying on you to come up with something good. It's okay. This is where you want to be.
author: Nick D.

description: Was looking for Mexican restaurant on Mission Street, but was not feeling the vibe.  Randomly came across Valencia Street & Puerto Alegre... so glad I did!!! Great 7 Mares for dinner & great Margarita ... Loved it!!!
author: Maria M.

description:
We went here after going on the wild SF walking tour of the mission district. Our tour guide recommended it and we were greeted promptly and there was even live music! 

The chips and 2 salsas they served were excellent.:.The frozen strawberry margarita was heavenly and the burrito was probably the best burrito I have ever eaten. The service was mediocre- not bad but not great either. 

We will definitely be back when we are in the area!
author: Lauren M.

description:
A solid choice for home style Mexican food amongst a bevy of hipster/fusion/upscale eateries that has stood the test of time. 

You've probably stumbled by here too, maybe after a  night out at the bar with pals or shopping. Perhaps, like me, you pass it all the time and never have given it a second look. 

However, Puerto Alegre is worth a second glance. Sure, it might not have artesian water or fancy pants ingredients you can't pronounce (I'm assuming you know enough Spanish words to make it through the Mission and in a legit Mexican restaurant), but the food is good. 

It ain't fancy--in fact, it seems a little dingy amongst all these new flashy spots. But, have a seat and savor one of the places that is truly the Mission. 

Everything here was pretty good. Not great. Service was kind of slow for a weekday lunch lull time spot (4 pm), but the waitresses were nice. The salsa that came with the chips was excellent. My fajitas were cooked nicely and I enjoyed my meal. The flan for dessert wasn't very good, but I'm a harsh flan critic. Prices are good for the area (all things considered), portions just ok. 

I like this plucky, unassuming little spot and it looks like it could be a lot of fun for happy hour.
author: Bianca U.

description:
Love this place and everything about it! Memories of eating and drinking here go back decades for me. Yes,you may have to wait,and rarely is it not louder than your conversation.
Excellent dishes,service and oh my yes, you might want a few drinks after that rough week.
author: Allen K.

description:
Let me start off with saying this place was super busy and the wait time for two was over 40mins. If I hadn't been told how great this place was I probably wouldn't have waited around. So plan ahead. 
The margaritas were good(not the best) but you can order some in a pitcher so that gives cool points! They have a good menu with lots of different options. I got the carne asada  burrito and wow it was huge and tasty! The meat was so tender!! My personal option it needed some heat but I love heat! My husband got classic combo and loved it. 
The servers were helpful and you could see how crazy busy they were. 
One thing it gets really loud in there.
author: Allison P.

description: Happened upon this great Mexican restaurant today. Food, cleanliness, service were all top notch. Will definitely return.
author: Renee C.

description: This is the everyday Tex Mex in San Francisco you are looking for. It's not fancy-and I don't want it to be. The food, margaritas, salsa and chips, and service are great.
author: Jeremiah L.

description:
Have been going to Puerto Alegre whenever we are in the city. To clarify this is not in the truest sense traditional Mexican but nonetheless very good. Food is always fresh and delivered with great tasting spices. 
The guacamole should be ordered always since the freshness and flavor will not disappoint you. If you are a fan of a mole sauce order the red mole. Not as heavy and thick as some and the chocolate flavor is well balanced. 

If you are ordering a margarita, and who isn't, upgrade to the supreme. Our table ordered them and they were very good. The drink is clearer and a more crisp delivery on the tried and true recipe, not so overpoweringly sweet and a clearer taste of tequila. 

Service is generally good and wait staff friendly and efficient. Stop in and visit with a group, fun place to go.
author: jack t.

description:
Lets begin with, I HATE Mexican food... I hate beans and tortillas...

But I love this place... the margaritas are to die for! It's absolutely worth the wait as it can get quite packed on the weekends...

If you enjoy food, give this place a try and order any of their plates sans the beans... ask for extra jalapenos and salsa... 

This is a gem in the Mission!
author: Nathan D.

description:
Well we're group of 4 for today's  lunch. I ordered prawn burrito, asked it for super spicy but it came with red sauce on top of the burrito and inside it had stiffed with jalapeño . I was expecting a spicy Mexican sauce inside . I really didn't like it with the jalapeño  inside. Disappointed.
My friends ordered chicken fajitas , chicken enchiladas and one ordered chicken burrito.
Everyone agreed that the seasoning was way too less. Food was very average. Don't expect a good mexican food here.
Their complimentary chips and salsa tasted old and they used canned tomato for salsa. No spicyness in the salsa.
author: Rambo R.

description:
A San Francisco Staple!
You can't go wrong eating or drinking at this establishment! It's the place for grub before a long night of drinking. It's the perfect recovery center. The Pozole and Menudo make for a full tummy while the Margaritas are the perfect lighter fluid. You can't go wrong here.
author: Gary H.

description:
My husband and I used to frequent Puerto Alegre at least once a month, but life got busy and we haven't been there in a while. Cut to a two weeks ago when I was walking down Valencia St. for a community project and I looked up and saw the Puerto Alegre sign painted on their building. My mind (and stomach) immediately went to their crunchy, shredded chicken tacos and margaritas. 

My husband and I both had the evening off and I suggested we go to Puerto Alegre and he was so excited! He had the enchiladas and I had my usual mentioned above. We had such a lovely time enjoying our meal and the service was great - as always. 

LOVE THIS PLACE.
author: Miss Tina Sparkle S.

description:
After walking by this place numerous times and seeing so many people eating there, we finally came in to give it a try.

Let's just say the outside is wayyyy cuter than the inside. Wasn't gonna let this stop us from eating there, plenty of ugly restaurants in SF with great food. Although the prices didn't match the restaurant. Wayy overpriced for what it was. 

The chips and salsa were the highlight of our dinner unfortunately. They didn't have any agua frescas last night. I had to drink Coke.... Yuck. 

I had the fajitas and the bf had a chicharron plate. 
My fajitas had so little chicken, the plate could have been vegetarian... He barely ate any of his food if that tells you something....

Dessert time! Flan?! Nope... They didn't have that either.... 

This place was a major disappointment, we spent $40 and didn't even have a cocktail. Definitely sticking to Tacolicious and waiting next time. Don't bother coming here. 

I will say our waiter was attentive and pleasant, she was the only star :)
author: Alan M.

description:
Great place for margs and a relaxing dinner environment with friends.

Not the best food but not the worst either.
author: Chris L.

description:
We came here one evening for dinner, the reviews of Puerto Alegre looked good, and it was highly recommended by a local.

There was about a 20-30 minute wait when we got here.  We waited around a bit, and were seated after awhile.  Once seated, I ordered their one item combo with chile relleno.  The dish came with rice, beans and salad.  I liked their salad, it was pretty basic with lettuce, tomatoes, and dressing.

The rice and beans were average, and I have had better.  I usually judge a restaurant by how good their rice and beans are.  The chile relleno was decent, but I've also had better chile relleno.

Overall, Puerto Alegre is a pretty safe bet for Mexican food.  You probably won't order anything bad, and the dishes are pretty standard.

Service was great!  They even refilled our chips/salsa without us asking.  Actually, I liked the salsa that came with the chips!
author: Emily S.

description: Old-school "LA Mexican-style" spot with decent margaritas, great combo dishes (taco, beans, rice) and a festive environment with the occasional Latin musicians serenading. The crispy taco is of course a safe bet are the enchilada. The salsa is just so-so, like most places in SF, and this is tragic as salsa is the backbone of Mexican cuisine. Still, a lovely place for a group night, often a wait, but patience is a virtue.
author: Brian J.

description:
I give my review for the thing I eat every time I come here: chicken quesadilla with avocado. Best one I have tried in my life (in the US) there's a reason there's always a wait for this place. The service is awesome, friendly and they give lotsa chips and salsa. Blonde haired server is especially sweet- we always get her. 
Their rice/bean side is good, as is their shrimp quesadilla. GO here.
author: S K.

description:
Eating lunch alongside the many faces of Frida Kahlo, whose painted portraits appeared on the wall in our corner of the room, was how we started an easy breezy Sunday afternoon.

With Cadillac Margaritas to drink, I ordered their Pozole Verde sopa, which apparently is a house specialty. With radishes, lettuces and limes all on the side to add at your heart's content, it was quite delicious. Very filling, too -- the meaty soup bowl took at least 20 minutes to consume at my leisurely pace, and I enjoyed every moment.

While not a fancy-schmancy restaurant -- Giants fans watching TV kept cheering/howling in the background -- the food here was decent and service was great.
author: Garett T.

description: Went here a few weeks ago with friends. Had some bebidas and chips, salsa and guacamole and just sat and talked. Very comfortable to hang out. Friendly staff.
author: Marco M.

description: Not only my favorite Mexican restaurant in San Francisco, it may be my favorite restaurant period. My first time visiting SF I sort of got lost in The Mission and stopped here for lunch. I've been coming back ever since. Now that I have kids, I don't do the pitchers of Margaritas anymore and I don't love the place any less. They are always very kind and friendly to families. Just a fantastic establishment all around.
author: Jason S.

description: I'm not a huge fan of spices and still thought the food was very good. The chips weren't very salty which didn't serve my liking and my sprite was a tad watered down. Overall it was good and definitely something to try again.
author: Fisher J.

description:
Slow service, mediocre food...thought it was going to be cheap because it's a dump, but it was $120 for three people (one of whom didn't drink alcohol). 
No Bueno.
author: Monica M.

description:
Came in for some margaritas and to rest after a long day of shopping. Margaritas are really strong. I checked in on Yelp and a $5 margarita coupon appeared as a thank you but when I showed it to my waiter he said he couldn't honor it cause it was for Cinco de Mayo only. It didn't say that. I was kind of pissed that he wouldn't accept it, even though I put my phone in his face to show it to him. He told me to come in during happy hour Mon-Fri and I could get the same deal. Well, I don't live or work around here so that's never gonna happen. We only stayed for one round and then left. 

The chips and salsa weren't that great either. They bring out two types of salsa. One is just plain nasty and tastes like sweet and sour sauce and the other is just cheap tasting. I definitely won't ever be back.
author: Dusty N.

description:
A bit crowded, but still amazing. There is always art on the wall and every now and then live music entertainment. 
Great service and great Mexican food. The quesadillas are delicious. However the nachos are odd, they are a bit dry and soggy.
I'd still recommend you try out this place, I enjoy it.
author: Jenise M.

description: Portion controlled not the best...Drinks and food not better than Chevys!!!!!! And Happy hr is a kids menu.
author: Ronna B.

description: Amazing service. Amazing food. Can't go wrong going here! We got the combo plate with cheese enchiladas and chicken tacos and it was so great. And the pitcher of margs was so good too! 10/10 recommend.
author: Delaney B.

description:
10/6/13. Dinner

Came here on a whim, trying to avoid that drunken crowd from Castro Street Fair. We were lucky to score half the booth at 7pm.

*Chicken Quesadillas ($8.75): Always good, crispy tortilla stuffed with grilled pollo and melted cheese. This is my BF's usual.

*Las Gemelas ($10.75): first time having it. It's tortillas stuffed with chili verde pork stew. Pork was diced and cooked tendered, in spicy green chili sauce. Served with black beans and rice. It's another great meal from Puerto Alegre.
author: Matt Y.

description: This place used to be good. I just returned and it was shockingly bad. The enchiladas had zero flavor. And the chili rellenos were soggy and just plain nasty. Also the rice portion was irritatingly small. I took one taste, and paid the tab. It was that bad. Avoid.
author: Martino P.

description: This place never disappoints. Great food and great drinks. However this new margarita is next level.
author: David R.

description: Manager very rude I was wachting  the game Mexico vs Venezuela  y I was the first  to go there. Later I half time one other customer  Anglo  say ti the waiter  I want to wachting basketball  game. Y the waiter  change the channel . Was very rude. I think  was first  come first  serve. I will never going back to there. The food was not that good. Very poor flavor and bad service
author: Enrique V.

description:
I love this little gem in the mission. My partner and I come in like clockwork for their  yummy chiliquiles and great service. 
Most Saturdays we can just walk in for brunch without a wait and grab a comfy booth. 
I love the family atmosphere and that they always make us feel welcome.
Sometimes the coffee takes a minute to come out but that's because their brewing a fresh pot, which means you're not drinking the 3 hour old stuff.
If you're looking for an old school place that's solid without crazy bells and whistles, you may have just found your new sanctuary.
author: tinkerbell e.

description: The best salsa, delicious chips taste freshly made, and great plates.  They stayed open today but donated their profits to immingrant-empowering organizations.  A must try!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Had dinner here with friends last week, its a total winner!

I had possibly one of the best mexican dinner plates I have ever had in my life -- I had the camarones la diabla. Super spicy shrimp in a chipotle sauce. DELICIOUS!

My friends really enjoyed their food too and the salsa they gave us withe the chips was great. Margaritas were great. The staff weren't that friendly though. I can't say service was bad, but both the hostess and our waiter had an impatient manner I didn't care for. However, when I am in town, that certainly will not keep me away! Haha. I would love to eat there again.
author: Zvezdana O.

description: Food is Awesome! Drinks are Strong!!! I can't complain!
author: Candace F.

description:
This place was awesome. Had dinner here on Saturday night. Food was excellent (we shared a pozole and a mixed fajita plate). The chips and salsa were free and were kept topped up all night.

The pitchers of margaritas went down even better, delicious!

Friendly efficient service and a live mariachi band really completed the night. 

Reasonable prices too. We had to wait 25 mins for a table on a Saturday evening, so best to reserve if possible.
author: Lauren M.

description:
The peach/strawberry margarita is Super Delish! Not to sweet, hint of lime, just right! 

I had the chicken mole plate and the mole was really good. Had a little bit of a kick to eat and I really like the rice they use.

Their salsa is the also really good. Tangy and it goes we'll on everything.bI could drink it.
author: Miriam B.

description:
Puerto Alegre was my first Mission excursion when I moved to the city years ago but got turned away because it was too crowded. I never thought much more of it nor returned but I presumed the food must have been pretty darn good. Now that I've been, I can safely say it's probably the margaritas and not the food. 

Not that the food is bad but it's just not memorable. They are good accompaniments to the booze but stand out little beyond that. I had the Milanesa (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vp1VTH08YSA9O9w6ej-G0A?select=-TGpalOTGPbhPe2lSQpJDA) and while I wished the breading wasn't falling off the meat, it tasted alright. 

But I guess the star of the show is the margarita. Pitchers and pitchers of margaritas. So drink up and be merry. While you're at it, perhaps grab a bite too I guess.
author: Jon L.

description:
Drove up to here from South Bay Dia de los Muertos to eat some Mexican food and meet with a few folks doing a Mission pub crawl after. YIKES, parking was horrendous, but the entire district was popping! Anyway... onto the actual review of the restaurant...

Food: I got the super carne asada burrito. Let me tell you right now, this is probably ONE OF THE BEST burritos I have had!! (Which is sort of funny, because we all went to El Farolito after drinking... haha. That was good too!) When this burrito shows up on the Yelp suggestions on mobile, definitely get it! It comes drenched in a tomato paste (i think) and is savory and succulent. Me eating this burrito sober is like eating a Golden Boy or El Farolito or Senores pizza drunk (sorry, best analogy I can come up with). 

I had a taste of the enchiladas and tamales; those were pretty good too. Tamales were a bit dry.

The chips + the salsa dips were good too! I mixed those in with my burrito for some extra goodness.

Service was good, my water was constantly refilled. 

Giving this 5 stars for now.
author: Justin S.

description:
First time here last Friday.

Their happy hour is only till 6 pm which sucks.

Food was mediocre.

Ambiance was alright.

All was ok until the guy working the front door came over to us in the middle of our meal and told us that he had a party of 7 coming in......Apparently my friend and I were sitting at the small table's area and he wanted to put all of the small tables together so he could fit this party of 7....Mind you there are no reservations required for this place.

In the end, we didn't move.....We finished up our drinks and left.

Our waitress was GREAT....Too bad I didn't get her name.

I don't think I'll be back.
author: This Is M E.

description: Love their mole, tacos, margaritas and enchiladas!!! This is the only place in the mission I will eat, I love this place!
author: Christina A.

description: No frills Mexican food, standard rice + beans + entree platters. Nice blended Margs. Good service.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
One of my favorite places in the city. Margaritas are good and strong. Salsas are delicious, food is great every time. Atmosphere is great. Service is friendly and quick, especially considering how hectic it can get in there.
The only thing that sucks is that there is always a long wait to be seated for dinner.
author: Sierra W.

description: Best Mexican food in SF hands down! Here all the time with new friends. The fajita platter is a MUST.
author: Davey S.

description:
This place never fails. It's the bomb.
Get a picture of margaritas and the 3 item combo.
Won't be disapionted. If you like authentic. Stop by and try. I give it a 5 becsuse i'm always satisfied when i go.
author: Mack J.

description:
5 stars !!!!

This place is where me and my girlfriend go to get the best Mexican food in the city.  Margaritas are strong and tasty.. Plus the food is always good.. But what keeps us coming back - the amazing service.. Family owned and operated.. And if you frequent Puerto often- family is exactly what you feel like..
author: Ryan B.

description: I have been here twice. The first time was when it was really packed that I lost my patience to wait for a seat. The second time. Only got a drink. It's a great place to eat and hang out.
author: C G.

description:
Long ago I remember (barely) going to some place in the mission in the afternoon with friends for pitchers of margaritas and some pretty solid chips and salsa and it was cheap!  I swore I'd go back but I could never remember the place.

After seeing so many of my friends checking in to this place I decided to check it out for my self.  Sure enough it's the same place I barely remember going to years earlier!

This is a great spot for drinks and chips and salsa.  The rest of the food I tried was pretty good too.  I'm definitely a fan.
author: Theron L.

description:
When I'm in San Francisco, this is where I go for my fix. This is my happy place and I thank G. for introducing me to it. I could probably eat here every day...

Yea, I can get a cheese enchilada, guacamole, chips, salsa and a margarita in NYC, but, I'm sorry to say, it just doesn't taste the same (yes, I realize there's a stereotype that one can't get good Mexican food on the East Coast and I'm playing right into that, but hey, we all know it's a little bit true, right?). 
Here, at Puerto Alegre, the food is superb and well, almost magical. My usual dish? Cheese enchiladas. Hands down the best green and red mole sauce and I have a tough time deciding between the two sauces. The guacamole has a slight amount of heat and no tomatoes and is the perfect accompaniment to the Classic Margarita, which is  nice and strong (it's difficult to not order two margaritas). I have enjoyed stuffing my face here many times and always get giddy knowing that I can come back.
author: Lisa A.

description: This place is really awful.  Every dish failed to live up to an even basic level of quality. Salsa tasted worse than what I buy at Costco, crispy tacos were greasy and the tortilla soup was one of the worst I've ever had. I had Mexican food on the side of the highway outside Puebla tat tasted better. This place is clearly making its money selling bad Mexican food to yuppies that don't know any better.
author: Rob B.

description: Bahhh your food and margs are always so great but yet again, tonight, the service was bad. Food was dropped off and no one stopped by for 20 minutes after.
author: Mellodee G.

description:
My boyfriend loves this place - and I can see why - the services is amazing, endless chips and salsa and the margaritas are great!

To me - there are so many Mexican places in the Mission, that it will take me forever to find a favourite - but this place was pretty good. The food was quick, and delish. And the service was spot on. 

We had the nachos, quesadilla platter, and two margs each. Price wise - was pretty good!

I'll defo be back for a "cheap and cheerful" after work drink and snack!
author: Kathleen G.

description: Prices are a bit steep but given the location, it's expected. Margaritas by the pitcher are weak, wouldn't recommend that route. I liked their crispy tacos as they were fried well and their house salsa is delicious. The enchilada not so much, kind of bland.
author: Briget P.

description:
The first word that comes to mind is "meh". 

In another city/town, I might think this place is better, but being a Mexican restaurant in the mission means you need to kick some ass... and my experience here didn't achieve that. I went with three other friends so we split a couple of margarita pitchers. The margaritas are definitely good, but I think there are much better ones in the neighborhood. I ordered the chicken enchiladas with the green mole sauce. They were pretty decent... I was satisfied but not impressed. Service was good, but not outstanding. It was really just a solid 3-star experience. I'm glad I am writing about it now because I don't think it will stand out in my mind in the future!
author: Mandy A.

description: Excellent Mexican food. Service is good and fast. I have visited this restaurant and I have had a good experience. Another one to my favorite restaurant in the city of San Francisco.
author: Horacio H.

description:
This place is my jam! The servers have always been the best and it keeps me coming back. Needless to say, the food is awesome. What's more awesome - the house margaritas!! Also, the red salsa rocks my socks off. I would drink it straight if that wasn't so weird.

If you like mariachi music, then you've found your restaurant mecca. It can be a little hard to talk during the walk-in bands playing, but if that bothers you - perfect. Dont come then. Just means I have to wait a few less minutes to get a table! lol

I love this place..
author: Mateo G.

description:
Just when I thought there was no good carne asada to be had in the upper mission, in comes Puerto Alegre. I've been here twice, both times I ordered the carne asada nachos. They reminded me of the kind in my hometown of San Diego. Chopped grilled steak. Guac. Sour cream. Jack cheese and pinto beans.  Whole beans instead of refried but it's all good.

The margaritas are decent too. I'm giving them a solid 4 stars because the lady in charge is super sweet and friendly.
author: William V.

description: Hands down the most authentic Mexican food I've ever had at a restaurant. Side note: I'm Mexican.
author: Faviola H.

description: By far my favorite mexican restaurant of all time!! I discovered this place a couple years ago because a friend of mine used to be a server here and i have been a regular ever since. I almost always order the chicken enchiladas poblanas, wow they are AMAZING every time. I've brought lots of friends and family here and they all enjoy it!! The staff here makes the experience that much better, they always remember me and seat/serve me right away!
author: Marisa T.

description: So much on this block has changed. I am so happy PA hasn't. The posole is great, the fajitas are great and the staff is great. Tip well! They work hard and keep prices reasonable where new businesses on the block haven't. Mmmm salsa.
author: Hillary L.

description: Why did the guy next to us order the same strawberry margarita and his was twice the size..charged us 8.15?? Wtf
author: Dee D.

description:
This place does well for the cost and the convenience. The food isn't terrible but it isn't the best sit-down style Mexican food I've ever had. I think I've had a better enchilada at a taqueria. To be fair, this place seems to be better equipped at their bar than in their kitchen. 

I'd recommend if you're in the mood for some quick melty warm food and maybe a margarita.
author: Sara M.

description: Wonderful. Hard to believe that in SF it's hard to find genuine, sit-down, Mexican food with a full bar & outdoor seating but this place has it all. Love it. Excellent service. Come support this great small business establishment.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Four of us were here on a Tuesday night around 8,30pm and there was a 25min wait. This place gets pretty full.  The host and waitress were nice and attentive. We went to Blondies bar next door, good place btw.
Food was better than average (too bad Rondalla is still closed) but the prices are HIGH. The guacamole is fresh but lacking, no tomatoes or much cilantro. More flavor here please.
it's a pretty old, run down establishment which is another reason why I'm wondering why their prices are SO high.
The original margarita was tasty.
You'll get less expensive and delicious Mexican food at Pancho Villa Taqueria or even La Corneta.
author: An A.

description: Awesome food in here! I've had my best Mexican food. The Milanesa special is definitely the one you have to order. Yummy!
author: Oliver B.

description: I come here at least a couple times a month. I'm addicted to the chimichanga special.. I get it every single time and i'm never not satisfied LOL. I love this place SO much.
author: Danielle S.

description: Could be the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to! Treated me and my family like regulars even though we were on our first visit! Food was excellent; Pozole Verde was soooo good. Chips and salsa were gr8. Many Margarita options..........Cadillac margarita was awesome!
author: William C.

description: Came here on a Saturday night, waited about 15-20 minutes for a table of two. Host was friendly and made sure we were taken care of even when our waiter was busy and left us stranded for a while. Our waiter voluntarily refilled our chips which I really appreciated! I had the vegetable fajitas and my sister had the chicken burrito. Both very good! We'll be back.
author: Emily A.

description: I love this place.  Good food fast service.  There is more "authentic" Mexican food here in the mission, and I love those places too.  But this is great Gringo mex and watch sports.
author: Ryan M.

description: Nice variety and super large portions, good to share and one of best margaritas
author: Natalia D.

description:
I used to say this was my favorite Mexican restaurant in San Francisco but tonite the food seemed to lack flavor and the Margaritas were weak. They always were pretty skimpy with their chips but now they serve only one small container of salsa, not the 2 different types we used to get. Unfortunately, they appear to be following the common pattern of raising prices while lowering quality.

Stopped by again today. seated quickly as usual and one container of salsa with chips arrived almost as we were sitting down. When our plates arrived I asked what happened to the 2 salsas they used to serve routinely and the nice young woman brought 2 more containers. I would say what i wrote last time is still accurate--less flavor than in the past and weak Margaritas. why not just forgo the Happy Hour special price and serve full-flavored drinks at the usual cost? I suppose we're expected to just order more Margaritas hoping that the flavor will build up, if only in our imagination as whatever alcohol they contain accumulates in our brains. I would say I've been disappointed the last couple of visits and I sure don't feel like hunting for another Mexican restaurant all over again. A not particularly good guitarist-singer performs a couple of songs, walks around expecting tips and leaves. An ok but not really very pleasant experience and one reason we pretty much just stay home and make our own tacos.
author: Aki T.

description: The best place for a fun and affordable Mexican dinner!  I love the margaritas and the people and the atmosphere!  We always come here before seeing a flick at The Roxie.
author: Gregarious B.

description: Most disappointing $46 lunch I've ever had. My brother ordered a salad bowl that was so wet he needed a straw. The chicken in my fajitas was dry but the rest of it was dripping in oil. Come here for the free chips and the strawberry margarita. Friendly service at least..
author: Sarah L.

description:
Who orders chicken soup - clear broth, chunks of carrots and zucchini, and literally half a chicken that's fall-off-the-bone tender - at a Mexican restaurant??

I do, baby, and it totally hits the G-spot (on my tongue).  And at $8.95 for a huge bowl, it's cheaper AND more satisfying than, say, a "toy" of equal quality and satisfaction.
author: Tori S.

description: One of the best Mexican food dives in the city.  I've literally been coming here since the 90's and will be coming as long as they'll let me in.
author: kate l.

description: Food was good. Price was reasonable.  Staff was outstanding.  Her name was Guadalupe she was personable, professional, and knowledgeable. She made the dining experience for us.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Sharing my love of Puerto Alegre again, 7 years later!!

No longer living in SF I find myself here each time I visit my love, San Francisco.

If you are a regular you will see the same faces, mostly family members who have been working here for years and years.  Nice people too. But perhaps a bit more jaded than 7 years ago with the influx of douchbaggery in The Mish.

I still love sitting at the bar but the table service is great as well.

I adore their chips and salsa, cliche, but I crave them.

Be warned: they do not advertise regular margaritas on their menu. The menu lists their specialty margaritas only, tricky!  But even at $9 or $10, the specialty margs are BOMB.
A perfected balance of agave, fresh lime, amazing tequila too in a simple rocks glass.  I could drink 10.  But I only had 2.  They treat you the same if you are eating or drinking but keep it moving people as this place gets packed. 

They are open every day for lunch and dinner, except Tuesday lunch. That day they have to close for lunch service to accept and put away deliveries. 

Smart operation.  Gay friendly.  Fun staff.  BOMB margaritas.
author: James S.

description: Overpriced relative to Mexican food that isn't authentic (mother and abuela are from Mexico... can't slip one past me) and just ok. (Note: the menu prices linked to this Yelp page are out of date. It's still not expensive, but again, overpriced relative to the final product). I think I was most disappointed when my friend ordered huevos rancheros and basically got ham and eggs. It was two eggs over easy over a slice of ham with a side rice and beans. The tortillas came plain in a separate tortilla holder. It didn't even have the tomato sauce which is fundamental to the dish. I don't have a problem with Americanized Mexican food (although the ham and eggs huevos rancheros was stretching it...) and probably wouldn't take as much issue if weren't for the "Authentic Mexican Food" bit on their front sign.
author: Monica M.

description:
My friends and I came here for our third drink stop of the Mission evening . We were told about the hush hush secret marg from a few friends.. It turned out to be the best of the three stops . A tequila infused with cucumber margarita on the rocks . Had some chips and salsa, black refried beans and rice to chase it down . 
I will come back for more later . A yes to here!
author: Noe'lle M.

description:
Amazing food! Try the pollo verde is incredible. Chicken nachos were good but the quesadilla was yummy! Buñuelos with icecream was the best desert in a very long time.

We had a really good experience at Puerto Alegre. Service was polite. Food was amazing and margaritas were really good as well. My favorite was the plata suprema.

I will def be back to this yummy place.
author: Alex R.

description: This place has AMAZING margaritas (won some awards too). Also my go to spot in general for some yummy authentic Mexican food. There is always a line in front of this place for a reason, but worth the short wait... The Fajitas, Pozole, and Mole' dishes are ridiculous here- you can't go wrong!
author: Gustavo G.

description:
Great food wonderful margaritas fun ambience

Went there today on spur of the moment for the first time I had two chimichangas with rice and beans and it was fantastic

I had two strawberry margaritas with peligroso and they were smooth and refreshing on this hot sunny day

We were fortunate enough to get a table outside on the sidewalk and the food was just mind blowing we will definitely go back I think it's our new favorite Mexican place it was sunny beautiful and filled with all kinds of different people and every kind of clothing you can imagine so much fun people watching
author: David F.

description:
The food is okay, typical sit down Mexican restaurant food. Definitely not homemade or the best Mexican food in SF. 
A fun place to go but make sure to go early, it's become very popular and the wait times can become ridiculous later in the evening.
Friends and I like to come here every once in a while to share a pitcher of strawberry margaritas. They're okay as well but it'll take more than one pitcher to get you tipsy.
If you want a good margarita in a pint glass go next door to Blondie's, while you wait.
author: Anica S.

description: This is the sorta place you probably went to with your family growing up in California. My husband and I have been coming here for years. The staff has been basically the same during that time, and they're great. The food is tasty, not mind blowing or very creative, but it's the bottomless thin, warm tortilla chips and pitchers of margaritas that are easy to go nuts on. Also, they're not on the menu, but a person can request a "skinny margarita"
author: B B.

description:
THE POZOLE.

Do yourself a favor and get it. Worth five stars all the way, and so perfect for a chilly or overcast San Francisco day in particular. Absolutely phenomenal flavors. The best pozole I've ever had!
author: Emmy M.

description: Expensive, long wait times, over rated, undelivered on taste and portions! This place is NOT what I remember it to be from years ago... There are FAR better in the Mission, and I will not be going back. Service was delightful though...
author: Jasmine W.

description: I've been coming here for many many years! The chip and salsa with a margarita are a staple. My favorite dishes are the crispy tacos and steak... It's a great place to come with friends or to come alone. The staff is always super friendly and makes everyone feel welcome.
author: Michele G.

description:
I love this place. Food is exactly what you expect, nothing fancy, just GOOD.
Staff: awesome
Food: awesome
Wait: sucks, but handled very well. They will come get you in blondes, so you have to be careful
Drinks: I love there margaritas! I have to be honest though, a year ago I'd give puerto a 5 star rating, but there margs have slipped! Not as strong and way sweeter. Maybe I need to be sweeter? Who knows, but no matter what I leave satisfied!!
author: zach B.

description: The quesadillas are super good and the service is great , I recommend also the had a man playing a guitar and it made it very authentic
author: Alex C.

description: Great authentic Mexican with SUPERB  hand made Margies!!  Lovely high energy vibe and great place to catch a game on one of many TV's.  Super friendly staff that always do their BEST!!!  Love it when the street players come in and do a few tunes!
author: Lynne P.

description:
This place is FUN!! Very lively place with excellent food and attentive and gracious servers. We started with yummy salsas and chips. Then moved on to very fresh, perfect guacamole. I had a dish called Las Gemellas and I can't wait to have it again. 
We had a large table and got pretty loud. Blended right in. I didn't understand the appeal of this particular place until we started eating. WOW!
Now I get it.
author: Diane W.

description: I have been here over the years.  I recently went back while visiting SFO and ate here.  I just had a quesadilla but the tortilla seemed homemade and everything was amazing. The atmosphere is very casual but upbeat.  Our server was very attentive.  We really enjoyed it.
author: Gabrielle M.

description: Best margaritas ever, food is amazing and super friendly staff.
author: Marlen V.

description:
Margaritas are the saving grace.

The hostess was incredibly rude, and the food was expensive and flavorless. 

In a region that is so abundant with cheap and delicious food, why this one in particular is so popular is beyond my comprehension. 

1/10 WOULD NOT BANG.
author: Maxine W.

description:
This is where I go if I want Mexican food in SF.
Good and friendly...    Full Bar, Great Tequila selection, and a band on the weekend evenings. 
Sometimes there is a wait because it's not that big and lots of people know how good it is.  I had the Mola enchalladas... Tasty!

Good Spot for sure.
author: Captain C.

description: Delicious!! Excellent customer service. As soon as I walked in, we were greeted by the bartender. He shows us our table. Our server came up the table, introduced himself and asked what we wanted to drink. Our waters were delivered seconds after and our margaritas arrived shortly after. I got the strawberry margarita and my date got the peach one. DELICIOUS!! 15 minutes later I got my burrito and my date got the Fajitas. The food was delicious, the customer service was phenomenal and the dining area. I will be back again. Go Tigers!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Drinks are the Bomb and the food is so yummy.
They also have "Great service ".
author: Michele T.

description: The food is not fantastic, but the margaritas are great. If you're just looking for a good marg, this is the place for you. But, if you're looking for good Mexican food, stop by any of the dozens of places in the area.
author: Amy Y.

description:
This place is pretty great.  

First time that we had been by, were seated right away... at a small table.  It was pretty crowded, and you know what they say-- if it isn't busy it's bad... SO we were happy to see that lots of folks were enjoying a late lunch here on Saturday.

We started with the house margarita, which was really delicious, and guacamole.
The salsas that were served to us were also really yummy... not too spicy, but definitely not bland.  

For lunch we ordered the Chicken Enchiladas Poblanas and a ground beef taco.  The sauce on the enchiladas was very tasty.  This was definitely not your run of the mill tex-mex food.  

Would definitely go again.  Thanks for the great lunch!
author: Cass H.

description: My last visit occurred recently after not having been here three years.  I had fond memories of the atmosphere, good food and margaritas.  Sadly, this place has really slipped downward.  The food was not flavorful.  The crispy taco shell was like one of those pre formed shells you buy down the Mexican aisle in grocery stores.  Definitely not recently deep fried.  The refried beans were runny and not warm.  I ordered a chicken enchilada and beef taco.  Instead the meal came with a beef enchilada.  The rice was mediocre, rice-a-roni Spanish or Mexican rice is better.  The service has much to work on as well.  Server took our orders, the meal came before the drinks.  The drinks then came when we were already halfway through our meal.  Even the water we ordered we had to ask for twice.  My partner ordered a beer, when server finally came with drinks, the beer was missing and a margarita was given.  It took TWO more times to ask the server for the beer.  Sadly, this place is no longer a gem.  i will not be going here again.
author: Firecracker P.

description:
Can't beat the combination of food and price; not to mention the friendly staff.
Since it's no more than a 10 minute drive from home, it's a place we go to for lunch.  We get there early enough so there's never a wait.  The basket of chips are always fresh; better than in most Mission restaurants.  The margaritas are served pretty quickly.  And I have to say, their chile verde is really good; the pork is always tender.  The portions are just the right size.  Not to much, not too little.  I also like the feel of the place--old school Mexican joint; not fancy, but the crowd always seems happy to be there.
author: Rosa C.

description: Yummy Yummy yummy!!!  Came here on a Friday night, and the place was booming.  We had a party of 5 and the wait was only 30 minutes, so hopped across the street for a beer while we waited.  We ordered a couple of pitchers of margaritas, chowed down on some delicious chips and salsa.  We all loved our food, and the Chile relleno was pretty delicious, I also opted for the non refried black beans which were killer. I would definitely come back for the good service, reasonable pricing and good food.  Not the best I have had since I live in So Cal, but it was pretty darn delicious.
author: Bryanna P.

description: I do not know why this place gets such a poor rating.  I have lived in SoCal for the last 10 yrs and this place is better than anywhere i have been down there.  It is no frills and has a homey mexico feel.  The guac is bomb and makes chipotle taste bland.
author: Simon G.

description: The margaritas were good and strong! This is def a place to get real Mexican food andI enjoyed it. Nothing was extra special but I was not at all disappointed. Great place to get exactly what you expect from a tiny Mexican restaurant.
author: Brittini S.

description:
